explanations.machine learning: The paper uses deep-learning methodologies to solve the portfolio optimization problem, which falls under the broader category of machine learning.
explanations.supervised learning: The paper transforms the original problem into a supervised problem, indicating the use of supervised learning techniques.
explanations.deep learning: The paper explicitly mentions the use of deep-learning methodologies and compares different deep learning models.
explanations.neural network: The paper discusses various deep learning models, which are types of neural networks.
explanations.long short-term memory: The paper compares LSTM models among other deep learning models for portfolio optimization.
explanations.LSTM: The paper explicitly mentions Long short-term memory (LSTM) as one of the models used in the study.
explanations.attention mechanism: The paper uses models with Self-Attention (SA) and Additive Attention (AA), which are types of attention mechanisms.
